utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wish you could all be inside my head. The conversation is sparkling. Fine, I’ll tell you. A lichen is an organism made up of two separate species, fungi and algae. If you could merge with another species, what species would you pick and why? Hint, there is a right answer. None of you will get it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, uh, I’d pick swan because, uh, the resulting hybrid would have the advanced industrial civilization of a human and the long graceful neck I’ve always dreamed of having.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wrong. Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Horse, but mostly just for the height. A little bit for the genital girth.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wrong, and let’s keep it clean, shall we?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Kangaroo, uh, I’d be a Kanga-Jew. The first of my people to dunk a basketball.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Also instead of just living in your mother’s house, you could actually live inside her body.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Clever, but also wrong. No, the best organism for human beings to merge with is the lichen itself. That way, you’d be human, fungus, and algae. Triple threat. Like three-bean salad.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Give me one circumstance in which that would be useful.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, picture this, a beautiful outdoor concert. Now, as a human, I appreciate Beethoven. As a fungus, I have a terrific view, growing out of a towering maple tree. And no thank you, expensive concessions. Because as an algae, I’ll just snack on this sunlight.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He got us again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, he didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Anyway, if it’s okay with you, we should talk about Howard’s bachelor party.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, seems like a bit of a let down after our lichen conversation, but, what do you know, you’re half swan.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ve been doing some research on strippers. One agency I spoke to, said I could get us a great price if we’re flexible on age range and number of limbs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sounds like loads of fun, but I promised Bernadette no strippers.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You don’t want strippers? You’re the king of strippers. The one club in North Hollywood named a pole after you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What can I tell ya, I’m not into that stuff any more.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good for you, Howard. I’m proud of you. And still, you’re the first one of us to get married. We have to do something special.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know Germans have an interesting pre-wedding custom.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, it’s probably not for me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe we can go up to Napa Valley. They’ve got that wine train.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Boo, wine! But yay, trains. I’m in.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Anyway, it’s a beautiful time of year. Uh, you travel through the vineyards. There’s a tasting on board. And all the wild flowers are in bloom. It’s magic.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look at that, in 30 seconds, we went from hiring women to being them.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, I hear you and the lost boys are having a bachelor party tonight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, just going to a restaurant, get some steaks and scotch. Nothing to worry about.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why should I worry?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know. It’s a bachelor party. There could be strippers. Wouldn’t that make you a little jealous?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on Leonard, it’s you. What’s going to happen? I mean, even if there was a stripper, all you’d do is avoid eye-contact and maybe offer to help her kid with his homework.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, I am a young man in his sexual prime. Under the right conditions, I-I-I am capable of just, really crazy stuff.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? What is the craziest thing you’ve ever done with a woman? And the time you and I had sex in the ocean does not count.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, come on, that’s got to count. There was a really strong undertow, we could have died.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, have fun tonight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I will. There is no telling what might happen.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, there is.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, there’s nothing wrong helping some woman’s kid get through their S.A.T.’s.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, I got to hand it to Raj, he found a really nice spot to have a bachelor party.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not bad. Unless you compare it to a train; then it stinks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you drinking whisky?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Indeed. If I’m to participate in the social convention that is the stag night, then I must embrace all its components, including tobacco, swear words, and yes, alcohol. Jeepers! That’s yucky.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Whoa, it’s a little early to start dropping J-bombs, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: Wil Wheaton
utterance.content: Hey, you guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Wil. Nice of you to make it out tonight for Howard.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Well, it was either this or another hot tub party at George Takei’s house.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m confused. I thought since our reconciliation, I was your friend in this group.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Oh, I’m friends with Howard too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. I guess you’re just friends with anybody. Aagh!

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey, uh, Leonard, things are a little tight at the comic book store. I might need some help covering my share of the check.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, no worries.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: And maybe a few bucks for the valet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, all right.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: And gas money to get home.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Great. You know what? This is my grandfather’s watch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: 18-carat gold, got it in Europe during the war.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow, that’s very nice.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. A hundred bucks and it’s yours.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, everybody! The bachelor boy has arrived! For he’s a jolly good fellow…

utterance.speaker: All (joining in)
utterance.content: For he’s a jolly good fellow, for he’s a jolly good fellow, which nobody can deny.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Yes, yes, yes. He’s a jowwy good fewwow. What time do the stwippers awwive?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Actually, Barry, we’re not going to have strippers tonight.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Ah, then what the fwig did I get two hundwed dowwaws in singles out for?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: You want to buy a watch?

utterance.speaker: Amy (into a mini-cam)
utterance.content: This is Maid of Honour Amy Farrah Fowler, bringing you the wedding activities just weeks out from the big day. Let’s check in with a beautiful, radiant young woman, and her friend who’s about to get married. Ladies, can you tell us what you’re doing?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Um, these are gift bags we’re going to put in the hotel rooms of our out-of-town guests. This is a map of Pasadena. This is a list of local restaurants. And then, for Howie’s relatives, we have antihistamines, antacids, and medicine for diarrhoea and constipation.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, we labeled them stop and go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right, pivoting to the big question. Bernadette, on your wedding night you’ll be consummating your marriage. What do you think your first sexual position will be as husband and wife?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Amy, please.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Keeping in mind that whoever’s on top may set the tone for the marriage.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, show’s over.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hey, they may conceive a child on their wedding night. Don’t you think the kid might get a kick out of knowing how it happened?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t care. Ask her things like are you going to take Howard’s name? Not who’s going to sit on who?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’ve actually been thinking I’m going to hyphenate: Bernadette Mary-Ann Rostenkowski-Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nice. You know, you should totally get BernadetteMaryAnnRostenkowskiWolowitz.com before someone snaps it up.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard already took care of it. Plus, he set up our beautiful wedding website with cute little facts about our family histories. Do you know, for a while in Poland, my family and his family were neighbours.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s cool.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, it’s not. I’ll explain it to you later.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: May I have your attention, please? We are hear tonight to celebrate the upcoming nuptials of my best friend Howard Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hear! Hear!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And, apparently, Wil Wheaton’s best friend.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Sheldon…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Talk to the hand.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Does anyone have any words they’d like to say about our man of the evening?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. . As is the tradition, I have prepared a series of disrespectful jokes which generate humour at Howard’s expense. Prepare to have your ribs tickled. Howard, I always thought you’d be the last one of us to ever get married, because you are so short and unappealing. Am I right? Let’s see here. Oh, seriously though, Howard, you’re actually one of the most intelligent people I know. And that’s a zinger, because you’re not. I’ve always thought that you’d make someone a fine husband someday. Assuming you’d be able to get the parts, and develop the engineering skills to assemble them, which I don’t see as likely. Hacha! Okay, let me see here. Okay, kidding aside, Howard, you are a good friend. And I wish you nothing but happiness. Bazinga, I don’t!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Doubleazinga! I do! Good luck following that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, Howard Wolowitz tying the knot. Leaving his crazy bachelor days behind. He was a wild one. Well, I guess we all kind of were. I remember this one time, I was with this girl at the beach. We were in the ocean and we started making out. I know, it was crazy. I wasn’t even wearing my Aquasocks. Then…

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Nobody cares, Hofstadter. Wwap it up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. To Howard.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: To Howard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I totally had sex in the ocean.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll go. Howard, when I think about you and Bernadette starting this wonderful life together, I can’t help but get a little choked up. I mean, look at you. You have everything. Look at me. I’m 37. I sleep in the back of a comic book store, and I have the bone density of an 80-year-old man. To Howard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, to Howard. Um, uh, who’s next?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: I’ll go. Howard, I’m gonna say something to you that evewybody’s thinking but no one has the couwage to say out woud. When you invite a man to a bachewor pawty, the impwication is, there will be stwippews. Maybe not compwetewy nude, but at weast pasties and G-stwings. That’s not unweasonable.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hear, hear.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hear, hear.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, uh, anybody else? Huh? No? Okay, it all comes down to me, the best man. Ooh! This grasshopper is kicking my ass-hopper. Okay, when I first came to this country, I-I didn’t know how to behave or how to dress, or what was cool, I was pretty lonely. But then I met Howard, and suddenly, my life changed, because we could be lonely together. This man became my whole world.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Yeah, nice speech, Fwancine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m not done, but thank you. I think back to all the good times we had, like, uh, when we went camping and spent that night telling each other all our secrets. I told him I’m addicted to pedicures and he told me he lost his virginity to his cousin.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She was my second cousin.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And the first woman you ever disappointed sexually. Ba-da-bazinga!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, oh, yeah, and then there was the time when Leonard and I took Howard to Las Vegas and paid a hooker to pretend she was Jewish and that she wanted his little kosher pickle. Of all the Howard humping hookers stories, that one’s my favourite!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, buddy, that’s it. Sit down.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, oh, what about that tubby girl in the Sailor Moon costume at Comic-con?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t remember. Please sit down.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The only threesome I’ve ever had in my life, and I’m proud to say it was with this man right here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, please shut up.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, oh, don’t get me wrong, nothing happened with me and Howard. There was about 200 pounds of Sailor Moon between us.

utterance.speaker: Wil (filming on his phone)
utterance.content: Oh, Internet, this is so going all over you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Jeepers, I’m drunk.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you for picking us up. There’s a warning, right there, on the scotch bottle. You cannot be operatin’ heavy machinery after you had a snootful of this, laddie!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Funny. You boys have a nice time?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, it was great. And low-key, like I promised. No hanky-panky, no strippers. Just the guys telling jokes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How about you? Did you have a fun night? Yeah, we, uh, made gift bags, had wine, and then went online and saw this.

utterance.speaker: Raj’s Voice
utterance.content: Of all the Howard humping hookers stories, that one’s my favourite.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, we’re not that far from my apartment. If you stop the car, I can walk from here.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You ain’t goin’ anywhere, Threeway.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernadette, listen…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You lied to me. You said you told me about all the girls you’ve been with, but you never mentioned your cousin, the prostitute or Raj!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Seriously, you don’t even have to stop the car. Anything under ten miles an hour and I can combat-roll into the street.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, just to set the record straight, I didn’t hire the prostitute, she was a gift from him. Shame on you, Raj. That is not how we treat women in this country.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t you try and blame this on him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you, Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Zip it, pervert!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know what I’m going to do. I’m supposed to marry Howard in a couple of weeks and I’m not sure I even know who the man is any more.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m curious what’s bothering you most, the borderline incest, the prostitute or group sex with the girl dressed as the children’s cartoon?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Amy, remember when we went over things that would be helpful and things that wouldn’t?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Right. And that was…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: When I first met Howard, he seemed so innocent to me, just a sweet little guy who lives with his mother.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, if that’s what you like, I’ll take you to the comic book store, the place is full of ’em.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wait a minute. You set me up with Howard. Did you know about all the creepy stuff he was into?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, a little. You hear stuff.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why didn’t you tell me

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I was gonna, but I didn’t think it would go past the first date. Then, when it did, I thought for sure it wouldn’t go past you meeting his mother. Definitely not past the two of you sleeping together. I mean, the warning signs were there, this is really on you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: My God! I thought you were my friend.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t think that was helpful.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hi, Bernie, it’s me again. Please call me back.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, I am so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not your fault, it’s mine. I did all that stuff, not you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Actually, you did do one of them together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re upset. The convention is to bring an upset person a hot beverage.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, but what is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Chicken broth. It seemed culturally appropriate. Also, there was a single cube of chicken bouillon in the cupboard when I moved in and it’s been bothering me for the last eight years. So, as they say, two birds.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know what my next move is.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, Howard, I don’t know much about women.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, uh, that, that’s it. I don’t know much about women. Raj, you got anything?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ve got the phone number of the tubby girl from Comic-Con.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m not calling the girl from Comic-con.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right. More Sailor Moon for me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I just threw up the bachelor party.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Please come out, Bernadette. Let’s talk through this.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, leave me alone.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Perhaps you should give him a taste of his own medicine. Do you have a cousin who you find attractive?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Amy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hey, you introduced him to the sleazebag. I’m just trying to clean up your mess.

utterance.speaker: Howard (at the door)
utterance.content: Oh, hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I need to talk to Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I don’t think she wants to talk to anyone right now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, well, could you at least give her a message?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, sure, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Tell her I’m really sorry, and if she doesn’t want to marry me, I get it. But what I really want her to know is the guy that she’s disgusted by, is the guy that I’m disgusted by, too. But that guy doesn’t exist any more, he’s gone, and the reason is because of her. So, if this relationship is over, let her know that she made me a better man, and tell her thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God, Howard. That’s the most beautiful thing I’ve ever heard. And it came out of you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Penny has a message for you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I heard. Your voice, not unlike your mother’s, travels through walls.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you want me to go?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No. Come here. I’m still really mad at you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I get that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Is there anything else about your past I should know?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Couple things, but, you know, most of them happened overseas. I’ll tell you later.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, is the wedding still on?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, the wedding’s still on.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, thank God. I’m still a maid of honour.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, what the hell.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: This is kind of hot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s with the robe?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (taking it off)
utterance.content: I’m gonna have sex with you right here, right now, on that washing machine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, you’re not.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, please.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: If you want to do something, you can help me fold this sheet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Folding a sheet in my underwear, still pretty crazy.
